articles.description: Jacksonville will have back-to-back No. 1 overall picks, while Detroit and Houston follow at the top of Round 1.

articles.description: Former Oregon QB Robby Ashford, the No. 168 prospect in the 2020 class, transferred to Auburn on Monday.
articles.headline: Auburn Tigers land second QB transfer in Oregon Ducks' Robby Ashford

articles.description: The Nebraska Cornhuskers have transformed their quarterback depth chart through the transfer portal, adding former Florida State Seminole Chubba Purdy to a group that includes former Texas Longhorn Casey Thompson.
articles.headline: QB Chubba Purdy chooses to transfer to Nebraska after leaving Florida State football program

images.name: Lyn-j Dixon [608x342]
images.caption: Lyn-J Dixon had 104 carries for 635 yards and six touchdowns with Clemson in 2019, but has totaled only 52 carries for 238 yards in two years since.

images.name: Kai-Leon Herbert [608x342]
images.caption: Senior Kai-Leon Herbert was the No. 99 prospect in the 2017 class. He opted out of the 2020 season and has mainly been a reserve for Miami.

article.description: Hajj-Malik Williams threw for 266 yards and a score as Campbell led early and held on late for a 34-27 win over Mercer on Saturday night.

video.headline: Cannon gets a foot down to make sensational TD grab for Mercer
video.caption: Mercer's Robert Riddle lofts one over the Campbell DB, and Tucker Cannon gets a foot down while extending the ball for a touchdown.
video.description: Mercer's Robert Riddle lofts one over the Campbell DB, and Tucker Cannon gets a foot down while extending the ball for a touchdown.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Cannon gets a foot down to make sensational TD grab for Mercer) 2019/09/28 ESHEET

video.title: Cannon gets a foot down to make sensational TD grab for Mercer

article.headline: Williams, Hawkins lead Campbell to 34-27 win over Mercer

images.name: Cannon gets a foot down to make sensational TD grab for Mercer
images.caption: Mercer's Robert Riddle lofts one over the Campbell DB, and Tucker Cannon gets a foot down while extending the ball for a touchdown.

article.linkText: Williams, Hawkins lead Campbell to 34-27 win over Mercer
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- Hajj-Malik Williams threw for 266 yards and a score as Campbell led early and held on late for a 34-27 win over Mercer on Saturday night. Johnathan Hawkins ran for 106 yards and a touchdown on 13 carries for the Fighting Camels (3-1). Cameron Davis added 73 yards rushing and a score. Two Colin Gary field goals and a 44-yard interception return by defensive back Kam Prewitt had the Fighting Camels up 13-0 early in the second quarter. Mercer squeezed in a pair of field goals before the half and Campbell was up 13-6 at halftime. Mercer evened it 13-13 late in the third on a Robert Riddle touchdown throw but Williams answered with a 76-yard scoring strike to Davarius Bargnare to put Campbell ahead 20-13. Hawkins ran for his score to cap the next Campbell drive and extend the lead to 27-13 but Mercer's Deondre Johnson would return the ensuing kickoff 65 yards for a touchdown, cutting it to 27-20 with 10:39 to play. Each team scored again in the waning minutes for the final score, Campbell going up by two touchdowns before Mercer answered. Riddle had 125 yards passing for the Bears (2-3).

videos.headline: Cannon gets a foot down to make sensational TD grab for Mercer
videos.description: Mercer's Robert Riddle lofts one over the Campbell DB, and Tucker Cannon gets a foot down while extending the ball for a touchdown.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Cannon gets a foot down to make sensational TD grab for Mercer) 2019/09/28 ESHEET
